=== Graphics ===
Open Source graphics applications that come either pre-installed or ready to be installed from the Ubuntu repositories.

==== Pre-Installed ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="text-align:left; font-size: 0.80em; border: none; width: 100%; background-color: #f1f1ed; font-weight: bold;"> Category
| Name
| Description Of Application
| Found In
|-
| Photo Management
| <nowiki>[[http://f-spot.org/Main_Page;|F-Spot]]</nowiki>
| Is meant to be an easy-to-use photo management application. It allows for importing of your existing photo collections, tagging photos with identifiers, as well as doing simple edits of photos (e.g. rotating).
| Graphics
|-
| Image Editor
| <nowiki>[[http://www.gimp.org/;|Gimp]]</nowiki>
| GIMP is the GNU Image Manipulation Program. It lets you draw, paint, edit images and also includes the functionality and plug-ins of other famous image editing and processing programs.
| Graphics
|-
| Image Viewer
| <nowiki>[[http://gthumb.sourceforge.net/;|gThumb]]</nowiki>
| An advanced image viewer and browser. It has many useful features, such as filesystem browsing, slide show, image catalogs, web album creation, camera import, image CD burning, batch file operations and quick image editing features like transformation and color manipulation.
| Graphics
|-
| Draw/Sketch
| <nowiki>[[http://www.openoffice.org/product/draw.html;|Open Office Draw]]</nowiki>
| This powerful graphics package enables you to draw anything from a quick sketch to a complex plan. DRAW gives you the tools to communicate with graphics and diagrams.
| Graphics
|-
| Scanning
| <nowiki>[[http://www.xsane.org/;|Xsane Image Scanner]]</nowiki>
| XSane is a graphical scanning frontend for SANE (Scanner Access Now Easy). It uses the SANE-library to talk to scanners. This means that XSane does not support any scanners itself. XSane is designed for acquiring images with scanners (there are other devices like cameras and videodevices supported by SANE and you will see that xsane may support some basic functions of those devices, but XSane is not designed for that purpose).
| Graphics
|}

==== Optional-Available in Repositories ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="text-align:left; font-size: 0.80em; border: none; width: 100%; background-color: #f1f1ed; font-weight: bold;"> Category

| Document Viewer
| <nowiki>[[http://www.gnome.org/projects/evince/;|Evince]]</nowiki>
| Evince is a document viewer for multiple document formats. It currently supports pdf, postscript, djvu, tiff and dvi.
| Graphics
|-
| Vector Drawing
| <nowiki>[[http://www.inkscape.org/|Inkscape]]</nowiki>
| Lets you draw and create infinitely resizable graphics. Simple tools which lend themselves well to all kinds of users. If you've ever wanted to make your own clip art, this program is the one for you. Uses the common web standard .svg format.
| Graphics
|-
| 3-D Graphics
| <nowiki>[[http://www.wings3d.com/|Wings]]</nowiki>
| Simple and easy to use polygon modeler. Great for making quick models and also a great choice for a first modeler. Exports in a variety formats.
| Graphics
|-
| 3-D Graphics
| <nowiki>[[http://www.blender.org/|Blender]]</nowiki>
| An incredibly advanced and complex commercial quality 3-D package. Compare to lightwave, maya, softimage and similar. Loads of options and features and a unique user interface.
| Graphics
|-
| Page Layout
| <nowiki>[[http://www.scribus.net/|Scribus]]</nowiki>
| A page layout and publication program. Allows for the creation of brochures, booklets, newspapers, magazines and similar, as well as exporting them to .pdf and other formats.
| Graphics
|-
| Color Chooser
| <nowiki>[[http://home.gna.org/colorscheme/|Agave]]</nowiki>
| Generates combinations of colors. Useful for creating color schemes or basic palettes.
| Graphics
|-
| Vector Drawing
| <nowiki>[[http://www.xaraxtreme.org/|Xara Xtreme]]</nowiki>
| Another vector graphics app. Create infinitely resizable graphics.
